Olfactory cortex superficial pyramidal c.AxonLength: Rat: several millimeters (association fibers extending to the olfactory bulb)

Olfactory cortex superficial pyramidal c.Comment: I notice that the location of axonal arborization field is filled with neuron types;  I believe these should be brain regions.
Olfactory cortex superficial pyramidal c.CellularSynapticTarget: Local: inhibitory intrinsic neurons; association fibers: pyramidal neurons; centrifugal: granule cells
Olfactory cortex superficial pyramidal c.SubcellularSynapticTarget: Local: intrinsic cell dendrites; association: spines of apical dendrites of pyramidal neurons; centrifugal fibers: granule cell dendrites
Olfactory cortex superficial pyramidal c.Definition: A cell with the classic pyramidal-shaped cell body and apical and basal dendritic trees, with cell body in layer IIb and superficial layer III of the piriform (olfactory) cortex.  Its axon arises from the deeper aspect of the cell body and gives rise to collaterals which terminate within the layer III on local intrinsic cells, and also recur to layer III, II and Ib where they form association fibers that connect to the apical dendrites of pyramidal neurons and continue to become centrifugal fibers to the olfactory bulb.
